data.title: Von Ertfelds
data.text: Good restaurant, but do not order the Lobster Mac and Cheese. $34 and no lobster! A rip off! Other dishes were all right. Vibrant surroundings and good service.

data.title: Great bar scene
data.text: Vibrant bar scene,  1.50$ oysters for happy hour, full drinkjs, great service at the bar fish dishes all good

data.title: Worth the trip from Hamilton
data.text: We were visiting our daughter at Colgate University and the town gets really crowded with few places to eat. We found this place by accident. Siri told us to eat here-not kidding. The atmosphere is fantastic and the food was good and reasonably priced. I will come here the next time we visit and bring others!

data.title: great atmosphere & good food, most of the time
data.text: i Have been here many times over the past year.  To this point the food has been either hit or miss.  The oysters and beer selection have always been satisfying.  The atmosphere is very nice and relaxed for my family to enjoy a night out together and engage in conversation without having to yell.  The problem I have experienced at times is the amount of salt in some of the entrees.  The chipino, ceviche, & risotto all have tasted like i was eating a pile of salt.  A server told me during the summer that the chef had been replaced and the food should be better going forward.  Im not sure if this is true but I had the snapper special and my wife ordered the scallops and ravioli.  Both were very good.  I hope this is a sign of more consistent food.

data.title: Great happy hour!
data.text: We came in for happy hour at the bar before heading to the John Mellencamp concert at The Stanley.  Great deal on oysters and beer and we loved both.  Service from the bartenders was excellent as well.

data.title: Don't waste your moneyc
data.text: It should be against the law to serve a tough filet mignon with shoestring fries.. no haddock on a Friday in Utica???? the only good thing were the cocktails but the price was too high for sure.  went back on a sat afternoon, were invited by a friend.. the chicken sandwich was pedestrian at best.

data.title: Great surroundings and delicious food!
data.text: Had dinner here with business contacts.  The rooftop location, decor and ambiance were quite enjoyable.  The seafood was perfectly prepared and not over cooked, which I greatly appreciated. I enjoyed the raw oyster selection and had the mussels as an entree.  Would definitely return should business bring me to Utica again.

data.title: ocean blue
data.text: New one in utica on top of old marine midland bank great views of the city and toward north food is very good a bit pricey but great atmosphere great service

data.title: Great time
data.text: Great atmosphere beautiful roof top seating. Above average food, drinks are expensive but view of the city is different and exciting so worth it

data.title: Nice Dining Experience
data.text: My wife and I ate here for our anniversary dinner. We were seated immediately (we had a reservation) and our server (Samantha) was very good. She was attentive and friendly without being overly so. The atmosphere was very good albeit a little mundane. I expected the establishment to be a bit more themed given its name. It is very roomy and you are not sitting on top of other diners. The noise level was good for conversation (it was not that busy) although there was background music playing the entire time (a bit of which didn't seem entirely appropriate given the demographic that this restaurant would seem to cater to). I had the lobster bisque which, was very good. It was a little more tomato based than most I have had but I did enjoy several large pieces of lobster contained therein (not always the case)! For my entree I had the filet mignon paired with roasted potatoes and wilted spinach. The sides were good although not extraordinary. The filet was cooked to my exact request and was excellent! The demi glace seemed very rich at first but I cleaned up every bit in the end. Our cocktails were also excellent as was the dessert and coffee. Portions were not too large but were more than ample.

data.title: Pricey but delicious
data.text: Traveling for business & this restaurant was recommended. I was quite surprised at the prices. The food was fantastic & the portions were large. I had the risotto & the waitress convinced me to add on the scallops for an additional $13. To my surprise the dish came with 2 scallops. Let me say again that the food was very good but seriously pricey. Even dessert was $12!  Next time I would stick to ordering appetizers & drinks.

data.title: Great place to meet up for happy hour
data.text: We have always enjoyed our visits to Ocean Blue as a couple but it's also a great place to meet after work with colleagues. It's very neat, clean, professional, and very nice to enjoy a drink on the deck.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: The place is a bit pricy, but lovely and the food is great.  Loved the lobster bisque and the crab cake.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Ambiance and meal were what I expected from a more urban area, so was pleasantly surprised when the elevator doors opened to the Ocean Blue. We had an outside table which was lovely on a warm summer night. My meal was delicious and all my table-mates enjoyed theirs as well. Service was outstanding and all staff are friendly and welcoming. Music indoors was a bit loud, so don't expect to have any meaningful conversations here.

data.title: Enjoy a Drink, Skip the Dinner
data.text: The owner is to be commended for creating a modern and attractive gathering spot that has contributed in an important way to the renewal of downtown Utica.  However, the high prices need to be adjusted or the offerings need to be upgraded, because what sounded really interesting on the menu didn’t turn out to be very special at all.  For example, our fish tacos were overloaded with mayonnaise, making them taste like a fast food production.  In addition, there was little atmosphere in the long rows of tables in the pretty noisy and bustling eating area.  What was good?  Our server, the fantastic bread, and the large choice of exotic cocktail drinks.   This looked like a fine place to go for a drink and some appetizers.

data.title: Get together
data.text: Very good! Great atmosphere and bar, staff and service was excellent. The rib nachos was outstanding!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: This restaurant is a great find in the middle of Utica, NY's downtown area. Located on the top floor of a large, refurbished building, the restaurant 's outdoor terrace offers a panoramic view of the city.  The menu offers a variety of dishes for all. The fresh oyster bar has multiple offerings of oysters and other seafood. I have had about 7 menu items and each one was delicious!! The Warm Butter Cake is a must for dessert!!!! Just can't say enough good things about this restaurant!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We had dinner here on a Sunday night. We had lunch here once before on their outdoor patio. This time we dined inside. Service was great.  The menu, while pricey, had varied choices.  Everything we ordered was delicious, and prepared perfectly. Drinks were served promptly and were good, the by the glass wine list included some very nice selections, and the dessert recommendation by our server was spot on. As I said before, this restaurant is expensive especially for this area, but it is worth it in my opinion.

data.title: Great lobster roll and crabcake
data.text: We had lunch, enjoyed everything. The dressing on the iceberg salad (blue cheese dressing) could be better. Lobster roll and crab cake delicious. Expensive but worth it.

data.title: Beautiful Summer Dinner
data.text:
My second dinner here but 4 th visit . This is the place for ambiance especially in the beautiful summer sunset . I have eaten at every restaurant around small and big , so I know good food and good service . 
I've had to give this place another chance sine I understand the new places have to work out their kinks . 
Tonight the service was better since no one was rushed over worked . The bartender let me try several wines before I decided on one I liked . She was very accommodating . The outside rooftop view is beautiful and comfortable . It's the chic place to be in Utica. Now the food .... The menu is not extensive has a few things of interest to most . A few things like steak , fish & chips , chicken , seafood . Menu is not big really . Everything ala Carta . Prices high for the area and food mediocre but you are paying for the atmosphere in my opinion . Nice experience but I can cook better than anything I've had there !
